There were no other sightings in Albuquerque on or around September 28th 2009
Summary: Bright star near moon just after sunset
divs: sighting detailsi submitted mufon report #18131 back in july - my third ufo sighting (1st in '75, 2nd in '98) and after attending a labor day gathering whereby various neighbors described having seen during the last 2-3 yrs in our area: a saucer, cigar, and orange orbs in addition to a large bright green ball descending over the jemez, i have kept a vigilant eye on the sky. additionally, there was mufon report #19550 of a glowing orb which was about 5 miles away from me although i did not see it and it did not involve anyone i know. anyway, on the eve of sept. 28, i had to go to the mini-mart in the little village of placitas located at the northern base of the sandia mountains which run north-to-south on the east side of albuquerque, before the store closed at 8pm. as i drove the 3 1\2 miles south to the mini-mart, i watched the moon and jupiter which were very bright as they rose up and to the west over the sandias. i recall looking at the car clock when i arrived at the mini-mart and it said 7:30, so i purchased what i needed and headed home. as the road is very winding, it takes about 15 mins to drive the short 3 1\2 miles back. once i made the turn onto my street - which runs due west - i looked left to admire the moon again and this time i saw a very bright "star" located about 10-15 degrees below the moon and 10 degrees to the west\right of that point, as i looked south. jupiter was to the left\east and a tad below the moon while this other "star" was almost at the same spot to the right\west of the moon. it was a tiny bit brighter than jupiter, and i knew it wasn't a plane and as i was only a hundred yards from home, i slammed on the gas pedal so i could get to my binoculars asap. however, in the 15 seconds it took me to get home, unlock the house, grab my binoculars and run outside the "star" was gone - nor was there any trace of a plane or any other flying object in the area. i wondered at first if i should even bother filing such a quick sighting but after i read 2 other similar mufon reports which also occurred on sept. 28th, near the us east coast describing almost the same thing at the same hour (only est), i thought it might have some significance. lastly, i hope to get my neighbors to file their respective sightings w\ mufon. thanks.
